column4: Help, GParted isn't seeing SDA, but Ubuntu 10.04 LTS install seems to know it's there....
So sda isn't listed in the drop down menu of drives?
Do you have any data on sda currently?
Quite a lot. I've got Ubuntu 10.10 and WinXP installed on it, have been using it for a while. I have backups, but obviously some info is not backed up and I'd like to get it back.
Did you do anything recently to the partition table?
not that I know of. I didn't do anything to it, and I'm going to guess that Updates don't usually touch it
Correct, updates should not touch the partition table. Can you still otherwise use this drive?

no. It's got my boot information (grub), and computer booting stops when it would normally reach the Grub screen. I can boot to liveCD (as I am currently). I can't mount the drive. However, Install sees it and says it has no partition table, but lets me partition it if I wanted (tho I won't)
Can you check the drive's SMART status in System > Administration > Disk Utility?
SMART status: not supported (I think this is normal, as my other HD, which is the same brand, etc also says that)
Wow, that would be the first internal drive I've seen that doesn't support SMART in a long time.
Are you using some type of "full disk" encryption?
no, only the secondary drive is encrypted
I would use testdisk to try to recover the partition table, then if that works treat the drive as being unreliable because it sounds like this problem was likely caused by hardware failure.
